newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazilian summertime to begin on October 6.
newsitem.headline: Brazilian summertime to begin on October 6.

text.p: Brazilian summertime will begin on October 6 when most of the country will put its clocks forward one hour, the Mines and Energy Ministry said.

Twelve states in the south, south-east and center-west regions, including Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro, plus the Federal District, which houses capital Brasilia, will adopt summertime, a ministry spokeswoman said.
Energy consumption is expected to fall one percent as a result of the change, she said.
